metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（张掖湿地站自动气象站-2021）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Zhangye wetland station from January 1 to December 31, 2021. The site (100.4464° E, 38.9751° N) was located on a wetland (reed surface) in Zhangye National Wetland Park, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1460 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AC; 5 and 10 m, north), wind speed profile (03002; 5 and 10 m, north), wind direction profile (03002; 10 m, north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2 and -0.4 m), and four photosynthetically active radiation (PQS-1; two above the plants, 6 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward; two below the plants, 0.25 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m and Ta_10 m; RH_5 m and RH_10 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m and Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, and Ts_20 cm) (℃), on the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_U_up and PAR_U_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)), and below the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_D_up and PAR_D_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2021-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2021年1月1日至2021年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游张掖湿地站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市国家湿地公园，下垫面是芦苇湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.4464E, 38.9751N，海拔1460m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在6m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.25m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm）(单位：摄氏度)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2021-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲面积占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting long-term ecological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集长期生态数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge faced in collecting long-term ecological data in arid and semiarid regions is the ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes and the degradation of natural vegetation, which can affect data collection and continuity, as mentioned in inland river basins westward along the Silk Road.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集长期生态数据面临的一个挑战是生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸以及自然植被的退化，这可能会影响数据的收集和连续性，正如丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域所提到的。

Example.QuestionEn: Provide an example of how datasets from oasis–desert systems can be used to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Example.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集如何用于理解能量、水汽和碳交换的一个例子。
Example.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis–desert systems, which include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, can be used to understand these exchanges by offering insights into the interactions between oasis and desert ecosystems. Such datasets, collected from multiple meteorological stations, are essential for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Example.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集，包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，可以用来理解这些交换，通过提供绿洲和沙漠生态系统之间相互作用的见解。这些数据集来自多个气象站，对于识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用、支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the meteorological data collected at the Zhangye Wetland Station in 2021?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 2021年张掖湿地站收集的气象数据的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature, relative humidity at 5m and 10m, air pressure at 2m, precipitation, wind speed at 5m and 10m, wind direction at 10m, four components of radiation, surface radiation temperature, soil heat flux, soil temperature at various depths, photosynthetically active radiation above and within the canopy
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度，5米和10米处的相对湿度，2米处的气压，降水量，5米和10米处的风速，10米处的风向，四个辐射分量，地表辐射温度，土壤热通量，各深度的土壤温度，冠层上方和内部的光合有效辐射。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features do datasets encompass for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 数据集涵盖哪些特征，以理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature gradients, humidity gradients, wind speed, wind direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, vegetation parameters, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度梯度、湿度梯度、风速、风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面、植被参数、土壤参数

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the arid regions of western China for the observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在中国西部的干旱地区，已经建立了多少个地表通量和气象站，以观测能量、水汽和碳交换？

Quantification.QuestionEn: Over what time period is the suite of observational datasets from oasis–desert systems, including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, collected?
Quantification.QuestionCn: oasis–desert系统的观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量，是在什么时间段内收集的？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'comprehensive observation network' mean in the context of meteorological and ecological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气象和生态数据收集的背景下，“综合观测网络”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of meteorological and ecological data collection, a 'comprehensive observation network' refers to a system of interconnected observation stations that collect a wide range of data related to surface processes, such as meteorological factors, radiation, and soil parameters. This network enables the study and monitoring of diverse environmental and climatic conditions across a specified area, such as the middle reaches of the Heihe River Basin.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气象和生态数据收集的背景下，“综合观测网络”指的是一个互联的观测站系统，收集与地表过程相关的广泛数据，如气象因素、辐射和土壤参数。该网络使得能够研究和监测特定区域（如黑河流域中游）的多样环境和气候条件。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'quality control' in the process of data collection and processing in meteorological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气象研究的数据收集和处理过程中，“质量控制”的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: In meteorological studies, 'quality control' is crucial for ensuring the accuracy and reliability of collected data. It involves processes such as detecting and marking missing data, removing duplicate records, filtering out data that exceed physical or instrumental limits, and highlighting questionable data. These steps help maintain the integrity and usability of the dataset for further analysis and research.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气象研究中，“质量控制”对于确保收集数据的准确性和可靠性至关重要。它涉及检测和标记缺失数据、删除重复记录、过滤超出物理或仪器限制的数据，以及突出可疑数据。这些步骤有助于维护数据集的完整性和可用性，以便进行进一步的分析和研究。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in observational parameters between the automatic meteorological station at the Zhangye Wetland Station and the oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 张掖湿地站的自动气象站与绿洲-沙漠系统之间的观测参数差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Zhangye Wetland Station records parameters such as air temperature, humidity, pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation, and soil temperature at various depths. The oasis–desert systems also include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, as well as hydrometeorological data, indicating a broader set of parameters related to fluxes and additional auxiliary data in comparison to the meteorological focus of the Zhangye Station.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 张掖湿地站记录的参数包括空气温度、湿度、气压、降水量、风速和风向、辐射以及不同深度的土壤温度。绿洲-沙漠系统还包括长期的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及水文气象数据，表明与张掖站的气象重点相比，涉及的通量相关参数和附加辅助数据更为广泛。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying environmental challenges can be inferred from the long-term patterns of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期模式中，可以推断出哪些潜在的环境挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The long-term patterns of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange may indicate challenges such as ecological degradation, drying of water bodies, and desertification, especially in arid inland river basins. These patterns highlight the need for sustainable management to balance oasis and desert systems and maintain ecological stability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换模式可能表明面临生态退化、水体干涸和沙漠化等挑战，尤其是在干旱的内陆河流流域。这些模式突显了可持续管理的必要性，以平衡绿洲和沙漠系统，维护生态稳定。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in maintaining data accuracy and quality in meteorological observations in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，维护气象观测数据的准确性和质量面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms, which can impact data accuracy and quality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化以及沙尘暴，这些都可能影响数据的准确性和质量。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to implement long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠系统中实施长期观测数据集是必不可少的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which are significant for maintaining the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对维持绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying reasons for using both artificial and natural oasis–desert systems in observational studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统进行观察性研究的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Using both artificial and natural oasis–desert systems helps to understand the interactions and balance between these ecosystems, which is vital for sustainable oasis development and achieving goals like carbon neutrality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 利用人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统有助于理解这些生态系统之间的相互作用和平衡，这对可持续绿洲发展和实现碳中和等目标至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects on data quality and reliability when implementing a comprehensive observation network with various sensor types in an arid region?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区实施综合观测网络并使用各种传感器类型时，对数据质量和可靠性的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a comprehensive observation network with various sensor types in an arid region can enhance the depth and breadth of environmental data, potentially improving understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. However, it may also introduce challenges in data quality and reliability due to the harsh environmental conditions that can affect sensor performance, requiring robust data processing and quality control measures to ensure accurate and consistent datasets.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区实施一个综合观测网络，配备各种传感器类型，可以增强环境数据的深度和广度，潜在地改善对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解。然而，这也可能由于恶劣的环境条件影响传感器性能而引入数据质量和可靠性方面的挑战，因此需要强有力的数据处理和质量控制措施，以确保数据集的准确性和一致性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of long-term observation datasets from oasis–desert systems influence the strategies for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观察数据集的整合如何影响可持续绿洲发展的策略？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating long-term observation datasets from oasis–desert systems provides a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. This information can significantly influence strategies for sustainable oasis development by informing actions that maintain ecological stability and socioeconomic development, ultimately supporting the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集提供了对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些信息可以显著影响可持续绿洲发展的策略，通过为维护生态稳定和社会经济发展提供信息，最终支持这些地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of dataset creation for oasis–desert interactions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在创建用于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的数据集时，为什么在绿洲和沙漠系统之间保持平衡很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial to achieve sustainable oasis development, support ecological security, and promote socioeconomic stability. Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these systems helps in achieving carbon peaking and neutrality goals.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、支持生态安全和促进社会经济稳定至关重要。理解这些系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the underlying goals for establishing and utilizing observational datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立和利用观察性数据集在绿洲-沙漠系统中的基本目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals include gaining a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges to recognize oasis–desert interactions, protect ecological stability, and support socioeconomic development, thereby contributing to sustainable oasis development and global carbon cycle management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括获得对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解，以识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，保护生态稳定，支持社会经济发展，从而促进可持续的绿洲发展和全球碳循环管理。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why are long-term observations considered indispensable for understanding oasis–desert ecosystems in research datasets?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么长期观测在研究数据集中被认为是理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统不可或缺的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial as they provide comprehensive data necessary for understanding the basic characteristics and interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems, which is essential for ecological stability, carbon balance, and supporting sustainable development goals.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观察至关重要，因为它们提供了理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统基本特征和相互作用所需的全面数据，这对于生态稳定性、碳平衡以及支持可持续发展目标至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to ensure the quality and accuracy of meteorological data collected from automatic weather stations in the context of oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，确保自动气象站收集的气象数据质量和准确性所采用的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control procedures involve ensuring daily data completeness, removing duplicate records, deleting data beyond physical or instrumental limits, and marking questionable data. The date and time are formatted consistently within the dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序涉及确保每日数据的完整性、删除重复记录、删除超出物理或仪器限制的数据，以及标记可疑数据。数据集中的日期和时间格式一致。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are observational datasets structured and what methodologies are employed to collect energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in arid inland river basins?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 观测数据集是如何结构化的，以及在干旱内陆河流流域中收集能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据采用了哪些方法？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observational datasets include long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. Auxiliary hydrometeorological data are collected via automatic weather stations at 10-minute intervals, supplemented with vegetation and soil parameters.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测数据集包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集的长期能量、水汽和碳通量数据。辅助的水文气象数据通过自动气象站以10分钟的间隔收集，并补充了植被和土壤参数。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental setups are necessary for capturing soil temperature and radiation profiles in an oasis–desert ecosystem, and how are these instruments typically positioned?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中捕捉土壤温度和辐射剖面的必要仪器设置是什么，这些仪器通常如何定位？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil temperature probes are installed at various depths, including the surface and underground at multiple depths (e.g., 2cm, 4cm, etc.), while radiation instruments are set up at specific heights and orientations, such as 6m high facing south for radiation measurement. Instruments include soil heat flux plates and various radiation sensors.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤温度探头安装在不同深度，包括表面和地下多个深度（例如，2厘米、4厘米等），而辐射仪器则设置在特定高度和方向，例如6米高朝南方向进行辐射测量。仪器包括土壤热通量板和各种辐射传感器。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational technologies enable the comprehensive monitoring of meteorological and surface processes in wetland ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些观测技术能够全面监测湿地生态系统中的气象和地表过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of automatic weather stations equipped with various sensors, such as those for air temperature, relative humidity, pressure, rain, wind speed and direction, radiation, and soil parameters, allows for comprehensive monitoring of meteorological and surface processes in wetland ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 配备各种传感器的自动气象站，如空气温度、相对湿度、气压、降雨、风速和风向、辐射以及土壤参数，能够全面监测湿地生态系统中的气象和地表过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or resources are necessary for the long-term observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观察能量、水蒸气和碳交换所需的条件或资源是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems require a network of land surface flux and meteorological stations, equipped with eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations, as well as the availability of auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测需要建立一个土地表面通量和气象站网络，配备涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，同时还需要提供关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in maintaining long-term data collection in oasis–desert systems, and how might these challenges impact the quality or continuity of datasets?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在维持绿洲-沙漠系统的长期数据收集过程中，预期会面临哪些挑战，这些挑战可能会如何影响数据集的质量或连续性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face challenges such as ecological environment degradation, drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors could potentially impact the quality or continuity of datasets by affecting observational conditions and data accuracy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临着生态环境恶化、河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴等挑战。这些因素可能会通过影响观测条件和数据准确性，从而对数据集的质量或连续性产生潜在影响。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be important to include a comprehensive suite of hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters in datasets for oasis–desert systems, and what outcomes are expected from such an approach?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集中包含全面的水文气象、植被和土壤参数可能很重要，以及这种方法预期会产生什么结果？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Including a comprehensive suite of hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters is crucial for a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, and supporting socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 包括全面的水文气象、植被和土壤参数对于定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、保护生态稳定性以及支持绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you think the current data collection methods are in capturing the interactions between oasis and desert systems, considering the challenges faced in arid and semi-arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为目前的数据收集方法在捕捉绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用方面有多有效，考虑到干旱和半干旱地区面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods, which include long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, as well as hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations, are crucial for understanding oasis-desert interactions. These methods are effective in capturing detailed and continuous data needed to assess ecological stability and support sustainable development goals in these regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪对能量、水蒸气和碳通量进行长期观察，以及来自自动气象站的水文气象数据，对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要。这些方法有效地捕捉到评估生态稳定性和支持这些地区可持续发展目标所需的详细和连续的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges involved in maintaining a comprehensive observational dataset in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中维护全面观测数据集所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges in maintaining a comprehensive observational dataset in oasis-desert ecosystems include dealing with ecological environment degradation such as drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors, especially prevalent in inland river basins, can hinder long-term data collection and affect the quality of observational datasets.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维护全面观测数据集的挑战包括应对生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素，尤其在内陆河流流域中尤为明显，可能会妨碍长期数据收集并影响观测数据集的质量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas are structured and managed for research purposes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集是如何结构化和管理的，以便用于研究目的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas are structured to include data on energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters. These datasets are collected from a network of stations, including superstations and ordinary stations, and are managed through a process of data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. They are often made freely available for research purposes through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集结构包括能量、水汽、碳通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数的数据。这些数据集来自一个由超级站和普通站组成的站点网络，通过数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享的过程进行管理。它们通常通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台免费提供给研究用途。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data processing and quality control procedures used in collecting meteorological and environmental data in arid and semi-arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述在干旱和半干旱地区收集气象和环境数据时使用的数据处理和质量控制程序。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure involves ensuring a consistent number of data entries per day (144, recorded every 10 minutes), marking missing data with a placeholder (-6999), removing duplicate recordings, and deleting data that exceeds physical or instrumental limits. Any questionable data is highlighted, and the format for date and time is standardized. The overall process includes data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing, with a focus on maintaining data integrity and accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序涉及确保每天有一致数量的数据条目（144条，每10分钟记录一次），用占位符（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，以及删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据。任何可疑数据都会被标记，日期和时间的格式也会标准化。整个过程包括数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享，重点是维护数据的完整性和准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the challenges faced in collecting long-term environmental data in inland river basins of arid and semi-arid areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域收集长期环境数据面临的挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting long-term environmental data in these regions include the degradation of ecological environments, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are particularly prevalent in inland river basins along the Silk Road, like the Tarim River basin, Aral Sea basin, and Lake Urmia basin.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在这些地区收集长期环境数据的挑战包括生态环境的退化，如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域中尤为突出，如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential data sources or repositories that can provide datasets on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的数据源或数据仓库，这些地方可以提供关于绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The National Tibetan Plateau Data Center is a potential source for datasets on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems. The datasets include observations from land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012 in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which is located in the arid regions of western China.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 国家西藏高原数据中心是一个潜在的数据集来源，提供关于绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集。这些数据集包括自2012年以来在中国西部干旱地区的黑河流域中下游建立的地表通量和气象站的观测数据。
